lines.value: who wants to be a millionaire

lines.value: abbreviated wwtbam and informally known as simply millionaire is an international television game show franchise of british origin created by david briggs mike whitehill and steven knight
lines.name: English

lines.value: in its format currently owned and licensed by sony pictures television large cash prizes are offered for correctly answering a series of multiple choice questions of increasing or in some cases random difficulty
lines.name: English

lines.value: the maximum cash prize in the original british version was one million pounds
lines.name: English

lines.value: most international versions offer a top prize of one million units of the local currency
lines.name: English

lines.value: the original british version of the show debuted on 4 september 1998 and aired on itv with chris tarrant as its host until 11 february 2014
lines.name: English

lines.value: then in 2018 jeremy clarkson took over for its revival
lines.name: English

lines.value: international variants have aired in around 160 countries worldwide
lines.name: English

lines.value: the show's format is a twist on the game show genre only one contestant plays at a time similar to some radio quizzes and the emphasis is on suspense rather than speed
lines.name: English

lines.value: in most versions there are no time limits to answer the questions and contestants are given the question before they must decide whether to attempt an answer
lines.name: English

lines.value: the contestants must first play a preliminary round called fastest finger first or in the us version simply fastest finger where they are all given a question and four answers from the host and are asked to put those four answers into a particular order in the first series of the british version and in pre 2003 episodes of the australian version the round instead required the contestants to answer one multiple choice question correctly as quickly as possible
lines.name: English

lines.value: the contestant who does so correctly and in the fastest time goes on to play the main game for the maximum possible prize often a million units of the local currency
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the event that two or more contestants are tied for the fastest time those contestants play another question to break the tie
lines.name: English

lines.value: if no one gets the question right that question is discarded and another question is played in the same manner
lines.name: English

lines.value: if any contestants are visually impaired the host reads the question and four choices all at once then repeats the choices after the music begins
lines.name: English

lines.value: main game contestants are asked increasingly difficult general knowledge questions by the host
lines.name: English

lines.value: questions are multiple choice four possible answers are given labelled a b c and d and the contestant must choose the correct one
lines.name: English

lines.value: the d answer on the first question except in the shuffle format like in the us version is always incorrect and humorous
lines.name: English

lines.value: upon answering a question correctly the contestant wins a certain amount of money
lines.name: English

lines.value: in most versions there is no time limit to answer a question a contestant may and often does take as long as they need to ponder an answer
lines.name: English

lines.value: after the first few questions the host will ask the contestant if that is their final answer
lines.name: English

lines.value: when a contestant says final in conjunction with one of the answers it is official and cannot be changed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first five questions usually omit this rule because the questions are generally so easy that requiring a final answer would significantly slow the game down thus there are five chances for the contestant to leave with no money if they were to provide a wrong answer before obtaining the first guaranteed amount going for 1000 units of currency after winning 500 units is the last point in the game at which a contestant can still leave empty handed
lines.name: English

lines.value: subsequent questions are played for increasingly large sums roughly doubling at each turn
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first few questions often have some joke answers
lines.name: English

lines.value: on episodes of the uk version aired between 1998 and 2007 the payout structure was as follows first going from £100 to £300 in increments of £100 then from £500 to £64000 with the pound value doubling for each new question and finally from £125000 to £1000000 with the pound value doubling for each new question
lines.name: English

lines.value: after viewing a question the contestant can leave the game with the money already won rather than attempting an answer
lines.name: English

lines.value: if the contestant answers a question incorrectly then all of their winnings are lost except that the £1000 and £32000 prizes are guaranteed if a player gets a question wrong above these levels then the prize drops to the previous guaranteed prize

lines.value: answering the £2000 and £64000 questions wrong does not reduce the prize money
lines.name: English

lines.value: the prizes are generally non cumulative that is answering a question correctly does not result in the amount being played for being added to the amount already won rather the amount already won is written off and replaced by a larger sum usually twice as large

lines.value: the idea to transform the uk programme into a global franchise was conceived by british television producer paul smith
lines.name: English

lines.value: he laid out a series of rules that the international variants in the franchise were to follow for example all hosts were required to appear on screen wearing armani suits as tarrant did in the uk producers were forbidden from hiring local composers to create original music instead using the same music cues used by the british version and the lighting system and set design were required to adhere faithfully to the way they were presented on the british version
lines.name: English

lines.value: however some of smith's rules have been slightly relaxed over the years as the franchise's history has progressed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the format of the show was created by david briggs mike whitehill and steven knight who had earlier created a number of the promotional games for tarrant's morning show on capital fm radio such as the bong game

lines.name: English

lines.value: since the original version launched several individuals have claimed that they originated the format and that celador had breached their copyright
lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2002 john bachini started a claim against celador itv and five individuals who claimed that they had created millionaire
lines.name: English

lines.value: bachini claimed they had used ideas from his 1982 board game format a two page tv format concept known as millionaire dating from 1990 and the telephone mechanics from another of his concepts bt lottery also dating from 1990
lines.name: English

lines.value: bachini submitted his documents to paul smith from a sister company of celador's in march 1995 and again in january 1996 and to claudia rosencrantz of itv in january 1996
lines.name: English

lines.value: bachini claimed that they used 90% of his millionaire format which contained all of the same procedures as the actual british millionaire's pilot twenty questions three lifelines two safe havens £1000 and £32000 and even starting from £1.00
lines.name: English

lines.value: bachini's lifelines were known by different names he never claimed he coined the phrase phone a friend but bull and tim boone claimed they did

lines.name: English

lines.value: the musical score most commonly associated with the franchise was composed by father and son duo keith and matthew strachan
lines.name: English

lines.value: the strachans score provides drama and tension and unlike older game show musical scores millionaires musical score was created to feature music playing almost throughout the entire show
lines.name: English

lines.value: the strachans main millionaire theme song takes inspiration from the mars movement of gustav holst's the planets and their question cues from the £2000 to the £32000/£25000 level and then from the £64000/£50000 level onwards take the pitch up a semitone for each subsequent question in order to increase tension as the contestant progressed through the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: on game show network gsn)'s gameshow hall of fame special the narrator described the strachan tracks as mimicking the sound of a beating heart and stated that as the contestant works their way up the money ladder the music is perfectly in tune with their ever increasing pulse
lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.name: English

lines.value: the basic set design used in the millionaire franchise was conceived by british production designer andy walmsley and is the most reproduced scenic design in television history
lines.name: English

lines.value: unlike older game shows whose sets are or were designed to make the contestant(s feel at ease millionaires set was designed to make the contestant feel uncomfortable so that the programme feels more like a movie thriller than a typical quiz show
lines.name: English

lines.value: the floor is made of plexiglas beneath which lies a huge dish covered in mirror paper
lines.name: English

lines.value: the main game typically has the contestant and host sit in hot seats which are slightly modified high pietranera arco all chairs situated in the center of the stage an lg computer monitor directly facing each seat displays questions and other pertinent information
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lighting system is programmed to darken the set as the contestant progresses further into the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: there are also spotlights situated at the bottom of the set area that zoom down on the contestant when they answer a major question to increase the visibility of the light beams emitted by such spotlights oil is vaporised creating a haze effect
lines.name: English

lines.value: media scholar dr robert thompson a professor at syracuse university stated that the show's lighting system made the contestant feel as though they were outside a prison while an escape was in progress
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the us millionaire introduced its shuffle format the hot seats and corresponding monitors were replaced with a single podium and as a result the contestant and host stand throughout the game and are also able to walk around the stage
lines.name: English

lines.value: according to vieira the hot seat was removed because it was decided that the seat which was originally intended to make the contestant feel nervous actually ended up having contestants feel so comfortable in it that it did not service the production team any longer
lines.name: English

lines.value: also two video screens were installed one that displays the current question in play and another that displays the contestant's cumulative total and progress during the game
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 2012 the redesigned set was improved with a modernised look and feel in order to take into account the show's transition to high definition broadcasting which had just come about the previous year
lines.name: English

lines.value: the two video screens were replaced with two larger ones having twice as many projectors as the previous screens the previous contestant podium was replaced with a new one and light emitting diode led technology was integrated into the lighting system to give the lights more vivid colours and the set and gameplay experience a more intimate feel
lines.name: English

lines.value: the battle of the beams was a period early in the second world war when bombers of the german air force luftwaffe used a number of increasingly accurate systems of radio navigation for night bombing in the united kingdom
lines.name: English

lines.value: british scientific intelligence at the air ministry fought back with a variety of their own increasingly effective means involving jamming and distortion of the radio waves
lines.name: English

lines.value: the period ended when the wehrmacht moved their forces to the east in may 1941 in preparation for the attack on the soviet union
lines.name: English

lines.value: prior to the war lufthansa and the german aircraft industry invested heavily in the development of commercial aviation and various systems and methodologies that would improve its safety and reliability
lines.name: English

lines.value: among these was a considerable amount of research and development of blind landing aids which allowed aircraft to approach an airport at night or in bad weather
lines.name: English

lines.value: the primary system developed for this role was the lorenz system developed by johannes plendl which was in the process of being widely deployed on large civilian and military aircraft
lines.name: English

lines.value: the lorenz system worked by feeding a special three element antenna system with a modulated radio signal
lines.name: English

lines.value: the signal was fed to the centre dipole which had a slightly longer reflector element on either side set slightly back
lines.name: English

lines.value: a switch rapidly alternated the opened midpoint connection of each reflector in turn sending the beam slightly to the left and then slightly to the right of the centreline of the runway
lines.name: English

lines.value: the beams widened as they spread from the antennas so there was an area directly off the runway approach where the two signals overlapped
lines.name: English

lines.value: the switch was timed so it spent longer on the right side of the antenna than the left
lines.name: English

lines.value: an aircraft approaching the airport would tune one of their radios to the lorenz frequency
lines.name: English

lines.value: if the crew found they were on the left side of the centreline they would hear a series of short tones followed by longer pauses the pauses being the time the signal was being sent out the other side of the antenna
lines.name: English

lines.value: hearing the dots they would know they had to turn to the right in order to be flying down the centreline
lines.name: English

lines.value: if they started on the right side they would instead hear a series of longer tones followed by short pauses while the signal was on the dot side of the antenna
lines.name: English

lines.value: hearing the dashes they would turn to the left to capture the centreline
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the centre the radio would receive both signals which sounded like a continual signal the so called equisignal
lines.name: English

lines.value: flying in the known direction of the runway and keeping the equisignal on the radio the lorenz could guide an aircraft down a straight line with a relatively high degree of accuracy so much so that the aircraft could then find the runway visually in all but the worst conditions
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the early 1930s the concept of a night bombing strategic campaign began to become paramount in military aviation circles
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was due to the ever increasing performance of bombers which were beginning to have the capability to strike across europe with useful bomb loads
lines.name: English

lines.value: these aircraft were slow and lumbering easy prey for interceptors but this threat could be essentially eliminated by flying at night
lines.name: English

lines.value: a bomber painted black could be spotted only at very short ranges
lines.name: English

lines.value: and as the bomber's altitude and speed increased the threat from ground based defences was greatly reduced
lines.name: English

lines.value: simply put planners believed that the bomber will always get through
lines.name: English

lines.value: the problem with night bombing is that the same limitations in visibility meant the bomb aimers would have a difficult time finding their targets especially a blacked out target at night
lines.name: English

lines.value: only the largest targets cities could be attacked with any probability of success
lines.name: English

lines.value: the concept of huge fleets of bombers flying unhindered over their enemy was so reprehensible that the royal air force raf built up its night bomber force largely as a deterrent
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was hoped that the fear of unrestrained attack against german cities would prevent the luftwaffe from considering attacks against england
lines.name: English

lines.value: to support this mission the raf invested very heavily in navigation training equipping their aircraft with various devices including an astrodome for taking a star fix and giving the navigator room to do his calculations in an illuminated workspace
lines.name: English

lines.value: this system was put into use as soon as the war began and was initially regarded as successful
lines.name: English

lines.value: in reality the early bombing effort was a complete failure with the majority of bombs landing miles away from their intended targets
lines.name: English

lines.value: the luftwaffe did not take such a fatalistic view of air warfare and continued to research accurate night bombing against smaller targets
lines.name: English

lines.value: not depending on celestial navigation they invested their efforts in radio navigation systems
lines.name: English

lines.value: the luftwaffe concentrated on developing a bombing direction system based on the lorenz concept through the 1930s as it made night navigation relatively easy by simply listening for signals on a radio set and the necessary radios were already being installed on many aircraft
lines.name: English

lines.value: lorenz had a range of about enough for blind landing but not good enough for bombing raids over the uk
lines.name: English

lines.value: this could be addressed by using more powerful transmitters and highly sensitive receivers
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition the lorenz beams were deliberately set wide enough that they could be easily picked up at some distance from the runway centreline but this meant their accuracy at long ranges was fairly limited
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was not a problem for blind landing where the distance covered by the fan shaped beams decreased as the aircraft approached the transmitters but for use in the bombing role this would be reversed and the system would have maximum inaccuracy over the target
lines.name: English

lines.value: for bombing use the modifications to lorenz were fairly minor
lines.name: English

lines.value: much larger antennas were needed to provide the required accuracy
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was achieved by using aerials with many more elements but it retained the simple switching of two of the reflector elements to alter the beam directions very marginally
lines.name: English

lines.value: the beam angles were so dramatically reduced that it was only a few tens of yards wide over the target
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was the shape of the aerials that gave the system its code name knickebein which means crooked leg
lines.name: English

lines.value: for the required range transmitted power was increased considerably
lines.name: English

lines.value: the knickebein receivers were disguised as a standard blind landing receiver system consisting apparently of the ebl 1 and the ebl 2 receivers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the beam from a single transmitter would guide the bombers towards the target but could not tell them when they were over it
lines.name: English

lines.value: to add this ranging feature a second transmitter similar to the first was set up so its beam crossed the guidance beam at the point where the bombs should be dropped
lines.name: English

lines.value: the aerials could be rotated to make the beams from two transmitters cross over the target
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bombers would fly into the beam of one and ride it until they started hearing the tones from the other on a second receiver
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the steady on course sound was heard from the second beam they dropped their bombs
lines.name: English

lines.value: the first of these new knickebein transmitters were set up in 1939 on stollberg hill in nordfriesland near the border with denmark at kleve cleves near the dutch border almost the most westerly point in germany and at lorrach near the border with france and switzerland in south western germany
lines.name: English

lines.value: following the fall of france in june 1940 additional transmitters were installed on the french coast
lines.name: English

lines.value: stations were also constructed in norway and the netherlands
lines.name: English

lines.value: knickebein was used in the early stages of the german night bombing offensive and proved to be fairly effective but the tactics for using the system in a widespread bombing effort were not yet developed so much of the early german night bombing offensive was limited to area bombing
lines.name: English

lines.value: efforts in britain to block the knickebein system took some time to get started
lines.name: English

lines.value: british intelligence at the air ministry led by r v jones was aware of the system initially because a downed german bomber's lorenz system was analysed by the royal aircraft establishment and seen to be far too sensitive to be a mere landing aid
lines.name: English

lines.value: also secretly recorded transcripts from german prisoner of war pilots indicated this may have been a bomb aiming aid
lines.name: English

lines.value: winston churchill had also been given ultra intelligence from decrypted enigma messages that mentioned bombing beams
lines.name: English

lines.value: when jones mentioned the possibility of bombing beams to churchill he ordered more investigation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the british codenamed the system headache
lines.name: English

lines.value: many in the air ministry did not believe that the system was in use and frederick lindemann leading scientific adviser to the government claimed that any such system would not be able to follow the curvature of the earth although t s eckersley of the marconi company had said it could
lines.name: English

lines.value: eckersley's claim was eventually demonstrated after churchill ordered a flight to try to detect the beams
lines.name: English

lines.value: lacking their own equipment capable of tuning in the 30-33 mhz lorenz signals an american hallicrafters s 27 amateur radio receiver was purchased from a shop in lisle street london
lines.name: English

lines.value: the receiver was fitted into an avro anson and operated by a member of the y service
lines.name: English

lines.value: the flight was nearly cancelled when eckersley withdrew his assertion that the beams would bend round the earth enough to be received
lines.name: English

lines.value: r v jones saved the flight by pointing out that churchill himself had ordered it and he would make sure that the prime minister would get to know who cancelled it.the crew were not told any specifics and were simply ordered to search for radio signals around 30 mhz having lorenz characteristics and if they found any to determine their bearing
lines.name: English

lines.value: the flight took off and eventually flew into the beam from kleve on 31.5 mhz
lines.name: English

lines.value: it subsequently located the cross beam from stollberg its origin was unknown prior to this flight
lines.name: English

lines.value: the radio operator and navigator were able to plot the path of the beams and discovered that they crossed right over the rolls royce engine factory at derby at that time the only factory producing the merlin engine
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was subsequently realised that the argument over whether the beams would bend round the earth was entirely academic as the transmitters were more or less in the line of sight to a bomber flying at high altitude
lines.name: English

lines.value: british sceptics started regarding the system as proof that the german pilots were not as good as their own who they believed could do without such systems
lines.name: English

lines.value: the butt report proved this to be wrong aerial reconnaissance returned photographs of the raf bombing raids showing that they were rarely if ever anywhere near their targets
lines.name: English

lines.value: efforts to block the knickebein headache were codenamed aspirin
lines.name: English

lines.value: initially modified medical diathermy sets transmitted interference but later on nights where raids were expected local radio transmitters broadcast an extra dot signal at low power
lines.name: English

lines.value: the german practice of turning on the beams long before the bombers reached the target area aided the british efforts
lines.name: English

lines.value: avro ansons fitted with receivers would be flown around the country in an attempt to capture the beams location a successful capture would then be reported to nearby broadcasters
lines.name: English

lines.value: the low power dot signal was initially transmitted essentially at random so german navigators would hear two dots
lines.name: English

lines.value: this meant there were many equi signal areas and no easy way to distinguish them except by comparing them with a known location
lines.name: English

lines.value: the british transmitters were later modified to send their dots at the same time as the german transmitters making it impossible to tell which signal was which
lines.name: English

lines.value: in this case the navigators would receive the equi signal over a wide area and navigation along the bombline became impossible with the aircraft drifting into the dash area and no way to correct for it.thus the beam was seemingly bent away from the target
lines.name: English

lines.value: eventually the beams could be inclined by a controlled amount which enabled the british to fool the germans into dropping their bombs where they wanted them
lines.name: English

lines.value: a side effect was that as the german crews had been trained to navigate solely by the beams many crews failed to find either the true equi signal or germany again
lines.name: English

lines.value: some luftwaffe bombers even landed at raf bases believing they were back in the reich
lines.name: English

lines.value: as good as knickebein was it was never intended to be used in the long range role
lines.name: English

lines.value: plendl had been working for some time to produce a much more accurate version of the same basic concept which was eventually delivered as x gerat x-apparatus
lines.name: English

lines.value: x gerat used a series of beams to locate the target each beam named after a river
lines.name: English

lines.value: the main beam weser was similar in concept to the one used in knickebein but operated at a much higher frequency
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to the nature of radio propagation this allowed its two beams to be pointed much more accurately than knickebein from a similarly sized antenna the equi signal area was only about wide at a distance of from the antenna
lines.name: English

lines.value: the beams were so narrow that bombers could not find them on their own so a low power wide beam version of knickebein was set up at the same station to act as a guide
lines.name: English

lines.value: the main weser antenna was set up just to the west of cherbourg in france
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cross signal in x gerat used a series of three very narrow single beams rhine oder and elbe
lines.name: English

lines.value: at about from the target the radio operator would hear a brief signal from rhine and set up his equipment
lines.name: English

lines.value: this consisted of a special stop clock with two hands
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the oder signal was received the clock automatically started and the two hands started to sweep up from zero
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the signal from elbe was received the clock reversed at which point one hand would stop and the other would start moving back towards zero
lines.name: English

lines.value: oder and elbe were aimed to be roughly from the bomb release point along the line of weser the exact distance depending on the distance from the transmitter meaning that the clock accurately measured the time to travel between the first two beams along the flight path
lines.name: English

lines.value: since the time taken to travel that distance should be the same as the time needed to travel the last from elbe to the target the moving hand reached zero and the bombs were automatically released
lines.name: English

lines.value: the timing of the elbe signal was adjusted to correct for the distance the bombs would travel between release and impact the range
lines.name: English

lines.value: since x gerat operated on a much higher frequency than knickebein around 60 mhz it required the use of new radio equipment
lines.name: English

lines.value: there were not nearly enough sets to go around so instead the experimental unit kampfgruppe 100 kgr 100 was given the task of using their sets to guide other aircraft to the target
lines.name: English

lines.value: to do this kgr 100 aircraft would attack as a small group first dropping flares which other aircraft would then see and bomb visually
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is the first use of the pathfinder concept that the raf would perfect to great effect against the germans some three years later
lines.name: English

lines.value: x gerat was used effectively in a series of raids known to the germans as moonlight sonata against coventry wolverhampton and birmingham
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the raid on birmingham only kgr 100 was used and british post raid analysis showed that the vast majority of the bombs dropped were placed within of the mid line of the weser beam spread along it for a few hundred yards
lines.name: English

lines.value: this was the sort of accuracy that even daytime bombing could rarely achieve
lines.name: English

lines.value: the raid on coventry with full support from other units dropping on their flares almost destroyed the city centre
lines.name: English

lines.value: x gerat proved more difficult to stop than knickebein
lines.name: English

lines.value: initial defences against the system were deployed in a similar fashion to knickebein in an attempt to disrupt the coventry raid but proved to be a failure
lines.name: English

lines.value: although jones had correctly guessed the beam layout and acknowledges it was only a guess the modulation frequency had been measured incorrectly as 1500 hz but was in fact 2000 hz
lines.name: English

lines.value: at the time it was believed that this would not make any difference as the tones were close enough that an operator would have a hard time distinguishing them in a noisy aircraft
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mystery was eventually revealed after an x gerat equipped heinkel he 111 crashed on 6 november 1940 on the english coast at west bay bridport
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the aircraft sank during the recovery operation the waterlogged x gerat equipment was recovered
lines.name: English

lines.value: on examination it was learned that a new instrument was being used that automatically decoded the dots and dashes and moved a pointer on a display in the cockpit in front of the pilot
lines.name: English

lines.value: this device was fitted with a very sharp filter which was sensitive only at 2000 hz and not to the early british 1500 hz counter signals
lines.name: English

lines.value: while the jammers were modified accordingly this came too late for the raid on coventry on 14 november but the modified jammers were able to successfully disrupt a raid on birmingham on 19 november
lines.name: English

lines.value: x gerat was eventually defeated in another manner by way of a false elbe which was set up to cross the weser guide beam at a mere after the preceding oder beam - much earlier than the expected
lines.name: English

lines.value: since the final stages of the release were automatic the clock would reverse prematurely and drop the bombs kilometres short of the target
lines.name: English

lines.value: setting up this false beam proved very problematic as the germans learning from their mistakes with knickebein did not switch the x gerat beams on until as late as possible making it much more difficult to arrange the false elbe in time
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the british slowly gained the upper hand in the battle of the beams they started considering what the next german system would entail
lines.name: English

lines.value: since germany's current approaches had been rendered useless an entirely new system would have to be developed
lines.name: English

lines.value: jones believed that if they could defeat this system quickly the germans might give up on the entire concept
lines.name: English

lines.value: british monitors soon started receiving intelligence from enigma decrypts referring to a new device known as y gerat which was also sometimes referred to as wotan
lines.name: English

lines.value: jones had already concluded the germans used code names which were too descriptive so he asked a specialist in the german language and literature at bletchley park about the word wotan
lines.name: English

lines.value: the specialist realised wotan referred to woden a one eyed god and might therefore be a single beam navigation system
lines.name: English

lines.value: jones agreed and knew that a system with one beam would have to include a distance measurement system
lines.name: English

lines.value: he concluded that it might work on the basis described by the anti nazi german mathematician and physicist hans mayer who while visiting norway had passed a large amount of information in what is now known as the oslo report
lines.name: English

lines.value: y gerat used a single narrow beam pointed over the target similar to earlier beam systems transmitting a modulated radio signal
lines.name: English

lines.value: the system used a transponder fug 28a that received the signal from the beam and immediately retransmitted it back to the ground station
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ground station listened for the return signal and compared the phase of its modulation to the transmitted signal
lines.name: English

lines.value: this is an accurate way of measuring the transit time of the signal and hence the distance to the aircraft
lines.name: English

lines.value: coupled with the direction of the beam adjusted for a maximum return signal the bomber's position could be established with considerable accuracy
lines.name: English

lines.value: the bombers did not have to track the beam instead the ground controllers could calculate it and then give radio instructions to the pilot to correct the flight path
lines.name: English

lines.value: the british were ready for this system even before it was used
lines.name: English

lines.value: by chance the germans had chosen the operating frequency of the wotan system very badly it operated on 45 mhz which just happened to be the frequency of the powerful but dormant bbc television transmitter at alexandra palace
lines.name: English

lines.value: all jones had to do was arrange for the return signal to be received from the aircraft and then sent to alexandra palace for retransmission
lines.name: English

lines.value: the combination of the two signals modified the phase shift &mdash and thus the apparent transit delay
lines.name: English

lines.value: initially the signal was retransmitted at low power not powerful enough for the germans to realise what was happening but enough to spoil the accuracy of the system
lines.name: English

lines.value: over subsequent nights the transmitter power was gradually increased
lines.name: English

lines.value: as y gerats use went on the aircrew accused the ground station of sending bad signals and the ground station alleged the aircraft had loose connections
lines.name: English

lines.value: the whole scheme appealed to jones as he was a natural practical joker and remarked that he was able to play one of the largest practical jokes with virtually any national resource that he required
lines.name: English

lines.value: the gradually increasing power conditioned the germans such they did not realise that anyone was interfering with the system but believed that it suffered several inherent defects
lines.name: English

lines.value: eventually as the power was increased enough the whole y gerat system started to ring with all the feedback
lines.name: English

lines.value: the luftwaffe finally realising that the british had been deploying countermeasures from the very first day that the system was used operationally completely lost faith in electronic navigation aids as the british had predicted and did not deploy any further system against great britain although by this time hitler's attention was turning toward eastern europe
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ecumenical patriarchate of constantinople (, oikoumenikon patriarkhion konstantinoupoleos ; ;, roman orthodox patriarchate is one of the fourteen autocephalous churches or jurisdictions that together compose the eastern orthodox church
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is headed by the ecumenical patriarch of constantinople currently bartholomew i archbishop of constantinople
lines.name: English

lines.value: because of its historical location at the capital of the former eastern roman byzantine empire and its role as the mother church of most modern orthodox churches the ecumenical patriarchate holds a special place of honor within orthodoxy and serves as the seat for the ecumenical patriarch who enjoys the status of primus inter pares first among equals among the world's eastern orthodox prelates and is widely regarded as the representative and spiritual leader of the world's 300 million orthodox christians
lines.name: English

lines.value: the ecumenical patriarchate promotes the expansion of the christian faith and orthodox doctrine and the ecumenical patriarchs are involved in ecumenism and interfaith dialogue charitable work and the defense of orthodox christian traditions
lines.name: English

lines.value: prominent issues in the ecumenical patriarchate's policy in the 21st century include the safety of the believers in the middle east reconciliation of the eastern orthodox and catholic churches and the reopening of the theological school of halki which was closed down by the turkish authorities in 1971
lines.name: English

lines.value: christianity in byzantium existed from the 1st century but it was in the year 330 that the roman emperor constantine the great moved his residence to the small greek town of byzantium renaming it nova roma
lines.name: English

lines.value: from that time the importance of the church there grew along with the influence of its bishop
lines.name: English

lines.value: prior to the moving of the imperial capital the bishop of byzantium had been under the authority of the metropolitan of heraclea but beginning in the 4th century he grew to become independent in his own right and even to exercise authority throughout what is now greece asia minor pontus and thrace
lines.name: English

lines.value: with the development of the hierarchical structure of the church the bishop of constantinople came to be styled as exarch a position superior to metropolitan
lines.name: English

lines.value: constantinople was recognized as the fourth patriarchate at the first council of constantinople in 381 after antioch alexandria and rome
lines.name: English

lines.value: the patriarch was usually appointed by antioch
lines.name: English

lines.value: because of the importance of the position of constantinople's church at the center of the roman empire affairs involving the various churches outside constantinople's direct authority came to be discussed in the capital particularly where the intervention of the emperor was desired
lines.name: English

lines.value: the patriarch naturally became a liaison between the emperor and bishops traveling to the capital thus establishing the position of the patriarch as one involving the unity of the whole church particularly in the east
lines.name: English

lines.value: in turn the affairs of the constantinopolitan church were overseen not just by the patriarch but also by synods held including visiting bishops

lines.value: this pan orthodox synod came to be referred to as the evδnuouoa ouvoδos endimousa synodos resident synod
lines.name: English

lines.value: the resident synod not only governed the business of the patriarchate but also examined questions pertinent to the whole church as well as the eastern half of the old empire
lines.name: English

lines.value: the patriarch thus came to have the title of ecumenical which referenced not a universal episcopacy over other bishops but rather the position of the patriarch as at the center of the oikoumeni the household of the empire
lines.name: English

lines.value: as the roman empire stabilized and grew so did the influence of the patriarchate at its capital

lines.value: this influence came to be enshrined in orthodox canon law to such an extent that it was elevated even beyond more ancient patriarchates canon 3 of the first council of constantinople 381 stated that the bishop of that city shall have primacy of honor after the bishop of rome because constantinople is the new rome in its disputed 28th canon the council of chalcedon in 451 recognized an expansion of the boundaries of the patriarchate of constantinople and of its authority over bishops of dioceses among the barbarians which has been variously interpreted as referring either to areas outside the byzantine empire or to non greeks
lines.name: English

lines.value: the council resulted in a schism with the patriarchate of alexandria

lines.value: in any case for almost a thousand years the patriarch of constantinople presided over the church in the eastern roman byzantine empire and its missionary activity that brought the christian faith in its byzantine form to many peoples north of the imperial borders
lines.name: English

lines.value: the cathedral church of constantinople hagia sophia holy wisdom was the center of religious life in the eastern christian world

lines.value: the ecumenical patriarchate came to be called the great church of christ and it was the touchstone and reference point for ecclesiastical affairs in the east whether in terms of church government relations with the state or liturgical matters

lines.value: in history and in canonical literature i.e the church's canons and traditional commentaries on them the ecumenical patriarchate has been granted certain prerogatives presbeia which other autocephalous orthodox churches do not have

lines.value: in the eighth and ninth centuries the iconoclast movement caused serious political unrest throughout the empire

lines.value: constantine v convoked a church council in 754 which condemned the worship of images after which many treasures were broken burned or painted over with depictions of trees birds or animals one source refers to the church of the holy virgin at blachernae as having been transformed into a fruit store and aviary

lines.value: the emperor constantine ix and the pope leo ix were allied through the mediation of the lombard catepan of italy argyrus who had spent years in constantinople originally as a political prisoner

lines.value: patriarch michael i ordered a letter to be written to the bishop of trani in which he attacked the judaistic practices of the west namely the use of unleavened bread
lines.name: English

lines.value: the letter was to be sent by john to all the bishops of the west including the pope
lines.name: English

lines.value: john promptly complied and the letter was passed to one humbert of mourmoutiers the cardinal bishop of silva candida who translated the letter into latin and brought it to the pope who ordered a reply to be made to each charge and a defence of papal supremacy to be laid out in a response
lines.name: English

lines.value: although he was hot headed michael was convinced to cool the debate and thus attempt to prevent the impending breach

lines.value: however humbert and the pope made no concessions and the former was sent with legatine powers to the imperial capital to solve the questions raised once and for all
lines.name: English

lines.value: humbert frederick of lorraine and peter archbishop of amalfi arrived in april 1054 and were met with a hostile reception they stormed out of the palace leaving the papal response with michael who in turn was even more angered by their actions
lines.name: English

lines.value: the patriarch refused to recognise their authority or practically their existence

lines.value: when pope leo died on april 19 1054 the legates authority legally ceased but they effectively ignored this technicality

lines.value: in response to michael's refusal to address the issues at hand the legatine mission took the extreme measure of entering the church of the hagia sophia during the divine liturgy and placing a bull of excommunication on the altar
lines.name: English

lines.value: the events of the east west schism are generally dated from the acts of 1054

lines.value: however these events only triggered the beginning of the schism

lines.value: the full schism was not actually consummated by the seemingly mutual excommunications

lines.value: the new catholic encyclopedia reports that the legates had been careful not to intimate that the bull of excommunication implied a general excommunication of the byzantine church

lines.value: the bull excommunicated only caerularius leo of achrida and their adherents

lines.value: thus the new catholic encyclopedia argues that the dispute need not have produced a permanent schism any more than excommunication of any contumacious bishop

lines.value: the patriarch had the immense support of the people against the emperor who had supported the legates to his own detriment

lines.value: despite their oaths and the threat of excommunication the crusaders ruthlessly and systematically violated the city's holy sanctuaries destroying defiling or stealing all they could lay hands on nothing was spared

lines.value: nicetas choniates gives a vivid account of the sack of constantinople by the frankish and venetian crusaders of the fourth crusade :'"the latin soldiery subjected the greatest city in europe to an indescribable sack

lines.value: for three days they murdered raped looted and destroyed on a scale which even the ancient vandals and goths would have found unbelievable

lines.value: constantinople had become a veritable museum of ancient and byzantine art an emporium of such incredible wealth that the latins were astounded at the riches they found

lines.value: though the venetians had an appreciation for the art which they discovered they were themselves semi byzantines and saved much of it the french and others destroyed indiscriminately halting to refresh themselves with wine violation of nuns and murder of orthodox clerics

lines.value: the crusaders vented their hatred for the greeks most spectacularly in the desecration of the greatest church in christendom

lines.value: they smashed the silver iconostasis the icons and the holy books of hagia sophia and seated upon the patriarchal throne a whore who sang coarse songs as they drank wine from the church's holy vessels

lines.value: the estrangement of east and west which had proceeded over the centuries culminated in the horrible massacre that accompanied the conquest of constantinople

lines.value: the greeks were convinced that even the turks had they taken the city would not have been as cruel as the latin christians

lines.value: the defeat of byzantium already in a state of decline accelerated political degeneration so that the byzantines eventually became an easy prey to the turks

lines.value: after constantinople was overrun by the ottoman turks in 1453 the patriarchate came to care more directly for all the orthodox living in the ottoman empire

lines.value: mehmed ii appointed gennadios ii scholarios as the patriarch in 1454 and designated him as the spiritual leader as well as the ethnarch or in turkish milletbashi of all the orthodox christians in the empire not just those of greek origin

lines.value: during this period bulgarians serbs albanians of southern albania and greeks of northern greece came under the spiritual administrative fiscal cultural and legal jurisdiction of the patriarchate

lines.value: some of the other patriarchs came at various points to live permanently in constantinople and function as part of the local church government

lines.value: this situation according to some of the orientalists and historians shows the pax ottomana or pax ottomanica literally the ottoman peace

lines.value: the russian orthodox church which for centuries had been a diocese of the ecumenical patriarchate declared its independence in 1448 shortly before constantinople fell owing to its protest over the council of florence in which representatives of the patriarchate had signed onto union with rome trading doctrinal concessions for military aid against the encroaching ottomans
lines.name: English

lines.value: the military aid never came and those concessions were subsequently repudiated by the patriarchate but from 1448 the russian church came to function independently

lines.value: within decades after the fall of constantinople to mehmed ii of the ottoman empire on 29 may 1453 some were nominating moscow as the third rome or the new rome".[2] 141 years later in 1589 constantinople came to recognize russia's independence and led the orthodox church in declaring russia also to be a patriarchate numbering moscow's bishop as fifth in rank behind the ancient patriarchates

lines.value: as ottoman rule weakened various parts of the orthodox church that had been under the direct influence of the ecumenical patriarchate came to be independent

lines.value: these churches at first usually declared their independence without universal approval which came after constantinople gave its blessing

lines.value: the rate at which these new autocephalous self-headed churches came into being increased in the 19th century particularly with the independence of greece

lines.value: in 1865 the romanian orthodox church against the protests of constantinople declared its independence which was acknowledged in 1885

lines.value: in addition to these churches whose territory had been agreed upon by all as within constantinople's jurisdiction several other disputed areas orthodox churches have had recognition by the ecumenical patriarchate as either autocephalous or autonomous including the finnish orthodox church and estonian orthodox church in 1923 the polish orthodox church in 1924 the czech and slovak orthodox church in 1998

lines.value: the majority of these disputes are a result of the expansion of the russian empire which often included a subjugation of the orthodox churches in conquered lands to the moscow patriarchate

lines.value: as a ruling institution the ottoman empire brought regulations on how the cities would be built quality reassurances and how the architecture structural integrity social needs etc should be shaped

lines.value: paul muldoon born 20 june 1951 is an irish poet
lines.name: English

lines.value: he has published over thirty collections and won a pulitzer prize for poetry and the t s eliot prize
lines.name: English

lines.value: he held the post of oxford professor of poetry from 1999 to 2004
lines.name: English

lines.value: at princeton university he is both the howard g b clark 21 professor in the humanities and founding chair of the lewis center for the arts
lines.name: English

lines.value: he has also served as president of the poetry society uk and poetry editor at the new yorker
lines.name: English

lines.value: muldoon was born the eldest of three children on a farm in county armagh outside the moy near the boundary with county tyrone northern ireland
lines.name: English

lines.value: his father worked as a farmer among other jobs and his mother was a school mistress
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 2001 muldoon said of the moy it's a beautiful part of the world
lines.name: English

lines.value: it's still the place that's burned into the retina and although i haven't been back there since i left for university 30 years ago it's the place i consider to be my home
lines.name: English

lines.value: we were a fairly non political household my parents were nationalists of course but it was not something as i recall that was a major area of discussion
lines.name: English

lines.value: but there were patrols an army presence movements of troops a sectarian divide
lines.name: English

lines.value: and that particular area was a nationalist enclave while next door was the parish where the orange order was founded we'd hear the drums on summer evenings
lines.name: English

lines.value: but i think my mother in particular may have tried to shelter us from it all
lines.name: English

lines.value: besides we didn't really socialise a great deal
lines.name: English

lines.value: we were blow ins - arrivistes - new to the area and didn't have a lot of connections
lines.name: English

lines.value: talking of his home life he continues i'm astonished to think that apart from some catholic truth society pamphlets some books on saints there were essentially no books in the house except one set the junior world encyclopaedia which i certainly read again and again
lines.name: English

lines.value: people would say i suppose that it might account for my interest in a wide range of arcane bits of information
lines.name: English

lines.value: at some level i was self educated he was a troubles poet from the beginning
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1969 muldoon read english at queen's university belfast where he met seamus heaney and became close to the belfast group of poets which included michael longley ciaran carson medbh mcguckian and frank ormsby
lines.name: English

lines.value: muldoon said of the experience i think it was fairly significant certainly to me
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was exciting
lines.name: English

lines.value: but then i was 19 20 years old and at university so everything was exciting really muldoon was not a strong student at queens
lines.name: English

lines.value: he recalls i had stopped
lines.name: English

lines.value: really i should have dropped out
lines.name: English

lines.value: i'd basically lost interest halfway through
lines.name: English

lines.value: not because there weren't great people teaching me but i'd stopped going to lectures and rather than doing the decent thing i just hung around
lines.name: English

lines.value: during his time at queens his first collection new weather was published by faber and faber
lines.name: English

lines.value: he met his first wife fellow student anne marie conway and they were married after their graduation in 1973
lines.name: English

lines.value: their marriage broke up in 1977
lines.name: English

lines.value: for thirteen years 1973-86 muldoon worked as an arts producer for the bbc in belfast
lines.name: English

lines.value: in this time which saw the most bitter period of the troubles he published the collections why brownlee left 1980 and quoof 1983
lines.name: English

lines.value: after leaving the bbc he taught english and creative writing at the university of east anglia and at caius college and fitzwilliam college cambridge where his students included lee hall billy elliot and giles foden last king of scotland
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1987 muldoon emigrated to the united states where he has taught on the creative writing program at princeton

lines.value: he was professor of poetry at oxford university for the five year term 1999 2004 and is an honorary fellow of hertford college oxford

lines.value: he's a riddler enigmatic distrustful of appearances generous in allusion doubtless a dab hand at crossword puzzles

lines.value: ernest ernie arthur coombs cm november 26 1927 - september 18 2001 was an american born canadian children's entertainer who starred in the canadian television series mr dressup
lines.name: English

lines.value: ernest coombs was born in lewiston maine and pursued a career in children's entertainment after attending north yarmouth academy in yarmouth maine
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was assistant puppeteer to fred rogers working with him at wqed in pittsburgh on rogers's noontime program the children's corner
lines.name: English

lines.value: rogers and coombs became close friends and when rogers was offered a show in 1963 at the canadian broadcasting corporation he invited coombes to join him in canada to work on an early version of mister rogers neighborhood called misterogers
lines.name: English

lines.value: rogers moved back to the united states three years later but coombs decided to stay in canada joining a new tv series called butternut square
lines.name: English

lines.value: butternut square ran from 1964 to 1967
lines.name: English

lines.value: during the run coombs appeared as the character in the poor alex theatre in the tickle trunk starring mr dressup with casey and finnegan after butternut square ended coombs developed mr dressup which became one of english canada's longest running and most beloved children's programs
lines.name: English

lines.value: as mr dressup he presented arts and crafts songs stories and games for children with his friends casey and finnegan a child and a dog who lived in a treehouse in mr dressup's back yard
lines.name: English

lines.value: casey was given a unisex name intentionally because the character's childlike voice left casey's gender ambiguous
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the years when viewers would ask coombs whether casey was a boy or a girl he would ask what do you think however the questioner responded he would say you're right later in the series when the show's principal puppeteer judith lawrence retired casey and finnegan were replaced by a small cast of anthropomorphic animal puppets
lines.name: English

lines.value: coombs believed in gentle wholesome children's programming that encouraged kids to use their creativity and imagination
lines.name: English

lines.value: in each episode mr dressup would dress up in a costume from his tickle trunk and lead children in an imagination game
lines.name: English

lines.value: many times his puppets would appear in costume as well
lines.name: English

lines.value: the series continued production until its final taping in february 1996 when coombs retired
lines.name: English

lines.value: repeats continued to be shown on cbc television until they were discontinued in 2006
lines.name: English

lines.value: after retirement coombs continued to work as an entertainer playing roles in ross petty's christmas pantomimes of peter pan cinderella and aladdin narrated a 2002 canadian revival of the british animated television series simon in the land of chalk drawings and acted as a spokesman for children's charities
lines.name: English

lines.value: coombs also did a travelling stage show called tales from the tickle trunk in this show he would share stories about the making of the mr dressup show as well as the origins and fates of some of the characters
lines.name: English

lines.value: coombs lived with his family in the city of pickering
lines.name: English

lines.value: his wife marlene ran a day care in scarborough east toronto called the butternut day care
lines.name: English

lines.value: they had three children christopher kenneth and catherine minott
lines.name: English

lines.value: marlene was killed in a traffic accident in 1992 she was walking on the sidewalk of yonge street in toronto when a car hit her
lines.name: English

lines.value: the driver may have had a seizure resulting in a loss of control of the vehicle
lines.name: English

lines.value: coombs became a canadian citizen in 1994
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1996 he was named a member of the order of canada
lines.name: English

lines.value: coombs suffered a stroke on september 10 2001 and died on september 18 2001 at the age of 73
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was cremated and his ashes scattered at his cottage in maine
lines.name: English

lines.value: a tribute was made to coombs in the canadian television show the latest buzz where the school for which the show is set is named ernie coombs high

lines.value: the mkhedrioni was a paramilitary group and political organisation in the republic of georgia outlawed since 1995 but subsequently reconstituted as the union of patriots political party
lines.name: English

lines.value: founded in 1989 by jaba ioseliani the mkhedrioni presented itself as the heir to historic georgian guerrilla groups who fought persia and ottoman occupiers
lines.name: English

lines.value: the group's name means horsemen translated literally but in georgian it has a meaning closer to knights this alternative translation has occasionally been used
lines.name: English

lines.value: each member of the organization would take an oath to defend georgia's people the georgian orthodox and apostolic church and georgia's land and wore a medallion with a scene of saint george slaying the dragon on one side and the bearer's name and blood type on the other
lines.name: English

lines.value: the establishment of the mkhedrioni took place as georgia moved towards independence in the final years of the soviet union
lines.name: English

lines.value: relations between georgian nationalists and the country's national minorities especially the abkhaz and ossetians were difficult at best even during soviet rule and grew more tense during the rise to power of the nationalist dissident zviad gamsakhurdia
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mkhedrioni was one of a number of nationalist paramilitary groups established during this period as a counterbalance to similar paramilitary organisations set up by rival nationalists elsewhere in georgia
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mkhedrioni's members gained an unpleasant reputation as heavily armed thugs who engaged in violent intimidation of their rivals
lines.name: English

lines.value: they were highly visible wearing what amounted to a uniform of jeans sweaters and jackets topped off by sunglasses even worn indoors
lines.name: English

lines.value: leaders wore armani suits bulging with guns according to one author
lines.name: English

lines.value: mkhedrioni relied on illegal sources of income targeting gasoline supplies and exploited connections with moscow's georgian underworld
lines.name: English

lines.value: mkhedrioni members were often accused of criminal activity extorting protection money from businesses in areas which they effectively controlled operating roadblocks where drivers would be fined smuggling drugs and committing robberies
lines.name: English

lines.value: by 1991 the mkhedrioni was claimed to have had about 1000 fighters and 10000 associate members considerably more than the official state national guard
lines.name: English

lines.value: despite gamsakhurdia and ioseliani sharing a broadly similar nationalist outlook the two men fell out badly shortly after gamsakhurdia came to power in november 1990
lines.name: English

lines.value: in february 1991 ioseliani was imprisoned without trial along with many of his supporters and the mkhedrioni was banned
lines.name: English

lines.value: in august 1991 just after the soviet coup attempt gamsakhurdia sacked tengiz kitovani the commander of georgia's national guard and his prime minister tengiz sigua resigned around the same time
lines.name: English

lines.value: kitovani soon formed an anti gamsakhurdia alliance with sigua and the imprisoned ioseliani
lines.name: English

lines.value: in december 1991 kitovani's supporters released ioseliani from jail and launched a violent coup d'etat against the gamsakhurdia government in alliance with the mkhedrioni
lines.name: English

lines.value: intense gun battles took place in the streets of tbilisi between the rebels and zviadists holed up in the state parliament building during december 1991 january 1992 which ended with gamsakhurdia fleeing to the breakaway russian republic of chechnya
lines.name: English

lines.value: at least 100 people were killed in the fighting
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mkhedrioni played a crucial role in suppressing the remaining zviadists after the downfall of gamsakhurdia
lines.name: English

lines.value: eduard shevardnadze a former soviet foreign minister was brought in to provide a respectable face for the new government but it remained dependent on the mkhedrioni even inside the parliament building mkhedrioni gunmen had a constant presence as bodyguards for jaba ioseliani who was now a member of parliament
lines.name: English

lines.value: mkhedrioni were given the role of the interior forces under the new government
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1993 worsening civil strife in abkhazia prompted the mkhedrioni and national guard to launch a joint operation in the region to root out separatists and gamsakhurdia supporters
lines.name: English

lines.value: this resulted in a disastrous defeat for the pro government forces who were driven out of abkhazia along with virtually the entire ethnic georgian population of the region over 10000 people were killed in the fighting
lines.name: English

lines.value: in september 1993 gamsakhurdia took the opportunity to launch an armed uprising in western georgia in an attempt to return to power
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mkhedrioni played an important role in suppressing the uprising and were for a while given semi official status as the georgian rescue corps
lines.name: English

lines.value: russian intervention ensured gamsakhurdia's defeat and on december 31 he reportedly committed suicide though it has also been stated and widely believed within georgia that he was murdered
lines.name: English

lines.value: mkhedrioni forces were alleged in press reports to be responsible for his death but they denied this
lines.name: English

lines.value: the mkhedrioni were subsequently given responsibility for rooting out zviadists in western georgia which they did with a brutal efficiency that was widely criticised by foreign governments and international human rights organisations
lines.name: English

lines.value: shevardnadze responded by gradually limiting the organisation's power
lines.name: English

lines.value: although ioseliani remained head of the supposedly civilianised organisation it continued to function as a private army
lines.name: English

lines.value: in early 1995 shevardnadze ordered it to disarm accusing it of deep involvement in organised crime
lines.name: English

lines.value: he narrowly escaped assassination in a bomb attack on august 29 1995 which he blamed on a shadowy coalition of mafia forces including ioseliani and others
lines.name: English

lines.value: other acts of political violence were also blamed on the mkhedrioni
lines.name: English

lines.value: the organisation was outlawed and ioseliani imprisoned although many regarded the claim that it had been involved in the bombing as being inconclusively proven
lines.name: English

lines.value: in spite of its banning the mkhedrioni continues to have a somewhat shadowy existence in georgian politics
lines.name: English

lines.value: a number of members led by tornike berishvili recreated it in 1999 as an ostensibly political rather than paramilitary organisation
lines.name: English

lines.value: it has been claimed that the mkhedrioni has had relations with chechen separatists and continues to be involved in criminal and paramilitary activities including continued guerrilla attacks in abkhazia
lines.name: English

lines.value: jaba ioseliani was released from prison in an amnesty in april 2000 and resumed his post as head of the mkhedrioni declaring his intention to run for president and participate in the november 2003 parliamentary elections
lines.name: English

lines.value: however ioseliani died of a heart attack in march 2003
lines.name: English

lines.value: when the mkhedrioni failed to secure registration to stand in elections under its own name it reconstituted itself in november 2002 as a political party called the union of patriots in alliance with former gamsakhurdia supporters
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was again refused registration by the government
lines.name: English

lines.value: its leader badri zarandia was assassinated on january 8 2003

lines.value: the northrop f 89 scorpion was an american all weather interceptor built during the 1950s the first jet powered aircraft designed as such from the outset to enter service
lines.name: English

lines.value: though its straight wings limited its performance it was among the first united states air force usaf jet fighters equipped with guided missiles and notably the first combat aircraft armed with air to air nuclear weapons the unguided genie rocket
lines.name: English

lines.value: the scorpion stemmed from a united states army air forces usaaf air technical service command specification military characteristics for all weather fighting aircraft for a night fighter to replace the p 61 black widow
lines.name: English

lines.value: the preliminary specification sent to aircraft manufacturers on 28 august 1945 required two engines and an armament of six guns either .60-caliber 15 mm machine guns or autocannon
lines.name: English

lines.value: the revised specification was issued on 23 november it did not specify jet propulsion but the desired maximum speed of 530 mph virtually dictated that all the submissions would be jet powered
lines.name: English

lines.value: the aircraft was to be armed with aerial rockets stored internally and six guns split between two flexible mounts four guns forward and two in the rear
lines.name: English

lines.value: each mount had to be capable of 15° of movement from the longitudinal axis of the aircraft
lines.name: English

lines.value: each mount's guns were to be automatically controlled by radar
lines.name: English

lines.value: for ground attack it had to be capable of carrying bombs and to be able to carry a minimum of eight rockets externally
lines.name: English

lines.value: bell aircraft consolidated vultee douglas aircraft goodyear northrop and curtiss wright all submitted proposals
lines.name: English

lines.value: in march 1946 the usaaf selected the curtiss wright xp 87 adapted from their proposed xa 43 attack aircraft and northrop's n 24 design one of four submitted by the company
lines.name: English

lines.value: the n 24 designed by jack northrop was a slim bodied swept wing aircraft with a two man pressurized cockpit and conventional landing gear
lines.name: English

lines.value: to reduce drag the two allison j35 turbojet engines were buried in the lower fuselage directly behind their air intakes and they exhausted underneath the rear fuselage
lines.name: English

lines.value: the horizontal stabilizer was mounted just above the junction of the vertical stabilizer with the fuselage and had some dihedral
lines.name: English

lines.value: a contract for two aircraft now designated the xp 89 and a full scale mock up was approved on 13 june although construction of the mock up had begun immediately after the usaaf announced that the n 24 had been selected
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was inspected on 25 september and the usaaf was not impressed
lines.name: English

lines.value: the inspectors believed that the radar operator needed to be moved forward closer to the pilot with both crewmen under a single canopy the magnesium components of the wing replaced by aluminum and the fuel stowage directly above the engines moved
lines.name: English

lines.value: other changes had to be made as wind tunnel and other aerodynamic tests were conducted
lines.name: English

lines.value: the swept wings proved to be less satisfactory at low speeds and a thin straight wing was selected instead
lines.name: English

lines.value: delivery of the first prototype was scheduled for november 1947 14 months after the inspection
lines.name: English

lines.value: the position of the horizontal stabilizer proved to be unsatisfactory as it was affected by the engine exhaust and it would be blanked out by airflow from the wing at high angles of attack
lines.name: English

lines.value: it was moved halfway up the tail but its position flush with the leading edge of the vertical stabilizer proved to cause extra drag through turbulence and reduced the effectiveness of the elevators and rudder
lines.name: English

lines.value: moving the horizontal stabilizer forward solved the problem
lines.name: English

lines.value: another major change occurred when usaaf revised its specification to delete the rear gun installation on 8 october
lines.name: English

lines.value: another inspection of the mock up was held on 17 december and the inspectors only suggested minor changes even though the fuselage fuel tanks were still above the engines
lines.name: English

lines.value: northrop's efforts to protect the fuel tanks were considered sufficient as the only alternative was to redesign the entire aircraft
lines.name: English

lines.value: the xp 89 had a thin straight mid mounted wing and a crew of two seated in tandem
lines.name: English

lines.value: the slim rear fuselage and the high mounted horizontal stabilizer led northrop employees calling it the scorpion a name later formally adopted by the air force
lines.name: English

lines.value: the intended armament of four 20 mm m 24 cannon in a small nose turret was not ready when the xp 89 was completed in 1948
lines.name: English

lines.value: pending the availability of either of the two turrets under development an interim six gun fixed installation with 200 rounds per gun was designed for the underside of the nose
lines.name: English

lines.value: the thin wing had an aspect ratio of 5.88 a thickness to chord ratio of 9% and used a naca 0009-64 section which was selected for its low drag at high speed and stability at low speeds
lines.name: English

lines.value: a further advantage of the straight wing was that it could accommodate heavy weights at the wingtips
lines.name: English

lines.value: the wing could not fit the circular type ailerons used in the p 61 so northrop used the decelerons designed for the unsuccessful xp 79 prototype
lines.name: English

lines.value: these were clamshell style split ailerons which could be used as conventional ailerons as dive brakes or function as flaps as needed
lines.name: English

lines.value: all flying surfaces the flaps and the landing gear were hydraulically powered
lines.name: English

lines.value: the thin wing dictated tall thin high pressure () mainwheel tires while the low height of the fuselage required the use of dual wheels for the nose gear
lines.name: English

lines.value: the terms of the initial contract were revised and formalized on 21 may 1947 with the price increased to $5571111
lines.name: English

lines.value: the delivery date of the first aircraft was scheduled 14 months july 1948 from signing and the second 2 months after that
lines.name: English

lines.value: a month before the prototype made its first flight on 16 august 1948 at muroc army air field the usaf changed its designation for fighter aircraft from p to f
lines.name: English

lines.value: the xf 89 was fitted with 4000 lbf 17.8 kn j 35 a 9 turbojets and proved to be seriously underpowered
lines.name: English

lines.value: initial flights were made with conventional ailerons decelerons not being installed until december

lines.value: several months earlier the air force conducted a competitive evaluation of the three existing all weather interceptor prototypes the xf 87 the xf 89 and the us navy's xf3d skyknight
