lines.value: the president of the republic of korea () is according to the south korean constitution the chairperson of the cabinet the chief executive of the government commander in chief of the armed forces and the head of state of south korea
lines.name: English

lines.value: the constitution and the amended presidential election act of 1987 provide for election of the president by direct secret ballot ending sixteen years of indirect presidential elections under the preceding two governments
lines.name: English

lines.value: the president is directly elected to a five year term with no possibility of reelection
lines.name: English

lines.value: if a presidential vacancy should occur a successor must be elected within sixty days during which time presidential duties are to be performed by the prime minister or other senior cabinet members in the order of priority as determined by law
lines.name: English

lines.value: while in office the chief executive lives in cheong wa dae the blue house and is exempt from criminal liability except for insurrection or treason
lines.name: English

lines.value: moon jae in former human rights lawyer and chief of staff to then president roh moo hyun assumed post of president of south korea on 10 may 2017 immediately upon being elected with a plurality of 41.1% in contrast to 24.0% and 21.4% won by his major opponents conservative hong joon pyo and centrist ahn cheol soo respectively
lines.name: English

lines.value: chapter 3 of the south korean constitution states the duties and the powers of the president
lines.name: English

lines.value: the president is required to the president may refer important policy matters to a national referendum declare war conclude peace and other treaties appoint senior public officials and grant amnesty with the concurrence of the national assembly
lines.name: English

lines.value: in times of serious internal or external turmoil or threat or economic or financial crises the president may assume emergency powers for the maintenance of national security or public peace and order emergency measures may be taken only when the national assembly is not in session and when there is no time for it to convene
lines.name: English

lines.value: the measures are limited to the minimum necessary the 1987 constitution removed the 1980 constitution's explicit provisions that empowered the government to temporarily suspend the freedoms and rights of the people
lines.name: English

lines.value: however the president is permitted to take other measures that could amend or abolish existing laws for the duration of a crisis
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is unclear whether such emergency measures could temporarily suspend portions of the constitution itself
lines.name: English

lines.value: emergency measures must be referred to the national assembly for concurrence
lines.name: English

lines.value: if not endorsed by the assembly the emergency measures can be revoked any laws that had been overridden by presidential order regain their original effect
lines.name: English

lines.value: in this respect the power of the legislature is more vigorously asserted than in cases of ratification of treaties or declarations of war in which the constitution simply states that the national assembly has the right to consent to the president's actions
lines.name: English

lines.value: in a change from the 1980 constitution the 1987 constitution stated that the president is not permitted to dissolve the national assembly
lines.name: English

lines.value: the official residence of the president is cheong wa dae
lines.name: English

lines.value: it means the house of the blue roof tiles so it is also called the blue house in english
lines.name: English

lines.value: the president is assisted by the staff of the presidential secretariat headed by a cabinet rank secretary general
lines.name: English

lines.value: apart from the state council or cabinet the chief executive relies on several constitutional organs
lines.name: English

lines.value: these constitutional organs included the national security council which provided advice concerning the foreign military and domestic policies bearing on national security
lines.name: English

lines.value: chaired by the president the council in 1990 had as its statutory members the prime minister the deputy prime minister the ministers for foreign affairs home affairs finance and national defense the director of the agency for national security planning ansp which was known as the korean central intelligence agency kcia until december 1980 and others designated by the president
lines.name: English

lines.value: another important body is the national unification advisory council inaugurated in june 1981 under the chairpersonship of the president
lines.name: English

lines.value: from its inception this body had no policy role but rather appeared to serve as a government sounding board and as a means to disburse political rewards by providing large numbers of dignitaries and others with titles and opportunities to meet periodically with the president and other senior officials
lines.name: English

lines.value: the president also was assisted in 1990 by the audit and inspection board
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition to auditing the accounts of all public institutions the board scrutinized the administrative performance of government agencies and public officials
lines.name: English

lines.value: its findings were reported to the president and the national assembly which itself had broad powers to inspect the work of the bureaucracy under the provisions of the constitution
lines.name: English

lines.value: board members were appointed by the president
lines.name: English

lines.value: one controversial constitutional organ was the advisory council of elder statesmen which replaced a smaller body in february 1988 just before roh tae woo was sworn in as president
lines.name: English

lines.value: this body was supposed to be chaired by the immediate former president its expansion to eighty members broadened functions and elevation to cabinet rank made it appear to have been designed as one seoul newspaper said to preserve the status and position of a certain individual the government announced plans to reduce the size and functions of this body immediately after roh's inauguration
lines.name: English

lines.value: public suspicions that the council might provide former president chun with a power base within the sixth republic were rendered moot when chun withdrew to an isolated buddhist temple in self imposed exile in november 1988
lines.name: English

lines.value: a culture hero is a mythological hero specific to some group cultural ethnic religious etc who changes the world through invention or discovery

lines.value: a typical culture hero might be credited as the discoverer of fire or agriculture songs tradition law or religion and is usually the most important legendary figure of a people sometimes as the founder of its ruling dynasty

lines.value: in some cultures there are dualistic myths featuring two culture heroes arranging the world in a complementary manner

lines.value: dualistic cosmologies are present in all inhabited continents and show great diversity they may feature culture heroes but also demiurges exemplifying dualistic creation myths in the latter case or other beings the two heroes may compete or collaborate they may be conceived as neutral or contrasted as good versus evil be of the same importance or distinguished as powerful versus weak be brothers even twins or be not relatives at all

lines.value: wilhelm martin leberecht de wette 12 january 1780 - 16 june 1849 was a german theologian and biblical scholar
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was born at ulla near weimar where his father was pastor

lines.value: he was sent to the gymnasium at weimar then at the height of its literary fame

lines.value: here he was much influenced by johann gottfried von herder who frequently examined at the school

lines.value: in 1799 he entered on his theological studies at jena his principal teachers being j j griesbach and h e g paulus from the latter he derived his tendency to free critical inquiry
lines.name: English

lines.value: in addition by the time he submitted his dissertation in 1804 september he was in regular contact at jena with jakob friedrich fries and karl david ilgen who perhaps led him to his contact with johann severin vater a scholar whose work he both admired and in some respects duplicated independently
lines.name: English

lines.value: both in methods and in results however he occupied an almost solitary position among german theologians
lines.name: English

lines.value: having taken his doctor's degree he became privatdozent at jena in 1807 professor of theology at heidelberg where he came under the influence of jakob friedrich fries 1773-1843 whose hiring he helped arrange as well as that of paulus and in 1810 was transferred to a similar chair in the newly founded friedrich wilhelm university in berlin where he became friendly with friedrich schleiermacher
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was however dismissed from berlin in 1819 on account of his having written a letter of consolation to the mother of karl ludwig sand the murderer of august friedrich ferdinand von kotzebue
lines.name: English

lines.value: a petition in his favour presented by the senate of the university was unsuccessful and a decree was issued not only depriving him of the chair but also banishing him from the prussian kingdom
lines.name: English

lines.value: he retired to weimar where he occupied his leisure in the preparation of his edition of martin luther and in writing the romance theodor oder die weihe des zweiflers 1822 in which he describes the education of an evangelical pastor
lines.name: English

lines.value: he began preaching at which he proved to be very popular

lines.value: but in 1822 he accepted the chair of theology in the university of basel which had been reorganized four years before

lines.value: though his appointment had been strongly opposed by the orthodox party de wette soon won for himself great influence both in the university and among the people generally

lines.value: he was admitted a citizen and became rector of the university which owed to him much of its recovered strength particularly in the theological faculty
lines.name: English

lines.value: de wette has been described by julius wellhausen as the epoch making opener of the historical criticism of the pentateuch he prepared the way for the supplement theory

lines.value: but he also made valuable contributions to other branches of theology

lines.value: he had moreover considerable poetic faculty and wrote a drama in three acts entitled die entsagung berlin 1823

lines.value: the california kingsnake lampropeltis getula californiae is a nonvenomous colubrid snake endemic to the western united states and northern mexico
lines.name: English

lines.value: it is a relatively small subspecies of the common kingsnake and is found in a variety of habitats
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to ease of care and a wide range of color variations the california kingsnake is one of the most popular snakes in captivity
lines.name: English

lines.value: the california kingsnake is widespread along the west coast of north america to elevations of approximately in the tehachapi mountains and to over in the southeastern sierra nevada mountains
lines.name: English

lines.value: this species lives in a wide variety of habitats including woodland chaparral grassland deserts marshes and even suburban areas
lines.name: English

lines.value: these snakes live in oregon california nevada utah arizona and northwestern mexico
lines.name: English

lines.value: in arizona they intergrade with the desert kingsnake and the mexican black kingsnake
lines.name: English

lines.value: the species has also become invasive on the spanish island of gran canaria
lines.name: English

lines.value: the california kingsnake is primarily diurnal but may become increasingly nocturnal during periods of particularly hot weather
lines.name: English

lines.value: in the winter they retreat underground and enter a hibernation like state called brumation
lines.name: English

lines.value: when disturbed california kingsnakes will often coil their bodies to hide their heads hiss and rattle their tails which can produce a sound somewhat resembling that of a rattlesnake
lines.name: English

lines.value: they are considered harmless to humans but if handled it is common for this species to bite as well as excrete musk and fecal contents from their cloaca
lines.name: English

lines.value: california kingsnakes are opportunistic feeders and common food items include rodents other reptiles birds and amphibians
lines.name: English

lines.value: all kingsnakes are non venomous but are powerful constrictors and generally kill their prey through suffocation
lines.name: English

lines.value: the king in their name refers to their propensity to hunt and consume other snakes including venomous rattlesnakes that are commonly indigenous to their natural habitat
lines.name: English

lines.value: california kingsnakes are naturally resistant to the venom of rattlesnakes but are not totally immune
lines.name: English

lines.value: as was discovered in studies of kingsnake muscle power california kingsnakes seem to have the strongest squeeze proportionate to body size of any snakes twice that of a similarly sized ratsnake or python
lines.name: English

lines.value: this adaptation may have evolved in response to the snake's diet of reptilian prey which needs less oxygen to survive an attack by constriction than mammals do
lines.name: English

lines.value: the california kingsnake is an oviparous internal fertilization animal meaning it lays eggs as opposed to giving live birth like some other snakes
lines.name: English

lines.value: courtship for this kingsnake begins in the spring and involves the males competing for available females
lines.name: English

lines.value: their mating ritual begins by the male snake vibrating uncontrollably
lines.name: English

lines.value: eggs are laid between may and august which is generally 42 63 days after mating in preparation the female will have chosen a suitable location
lines.name: English

lines.value: the typical clutch size is five to twelve eggs with an average of nine though clutches of 20 or more eggs are known
lines.name: English

lines.value: the hatchlings usually emerge another 40 65 days later and are approximately eight to thirteen inches in length
lines.name: English

lines.value: adult california kingsnakes are most commonly 2.5-3.5 feet in length and rarely exceed 4 feet
lines.name: English

lines.value: the california kingsnake is one of the most popular pet reptiles due to its ease of care attractive appearance and docile demeanor
lines.name: English

lines.value: due to natural color and pattern variability between individual snakes snake enthusiasts have selectively bred for a variety of color patterns and morphs
lines.name: English

lines.value: dozens of color variations are sold in the pet trade
lines.name: English

lines.value: wild type california kingsnakes are technically illegal to sell without special permits in their home state of california
lines.name: English

lines.value: these increased restrictions are due to a law that prohibits trafficking native california species within state lines
lines.name: English

lines.value: as captive bred morphs are generally exempt from these rules the law is loosely enforced
lines.name: English

lines.value: adamantios korais or korais (; ; ; 27 april 17486 april 1833 was a greek scholar credited with laying the foundations of modern greek literature and a major figure in the greek enlightenment
lines.name: English

lines.value: his activities paved the way for the greek war of independence and the emergence of a purified form of the greek language known as katharevousa
lines.name: English

lines.value: encyclopadia britannica asserts that his influence on the modern greek language and culture has been compared to that of dante on italian and martin luther on german
lines.name: English

lines.value: korais was born in smyrna in 1748
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was exceptionally passionate about philosophy literacy and linguistics and studied greatly throughout his youth
lines.name: English

lines.value: he initially studied in his home place where he graduated from the evangelical greek school
lines.name: English

lines.value: as an adult korais traveled to paris where he would continue his enthusiasm for knowledge
lines.name: English

lines.value: he translated ancient greek authors and produced thirty volumes of those translations
lines.name: English

lines.value: korais studied at the school of medicine of the university of montpellier from 1782 to 1787
lines.name: English

lines.value: his 1786 diploma thesis was entitled pyretologiae synopsis while his 1787 doctoral thesis was entitled medicus hippocraticus
lines.name: English

lines.value: after 1788 he was to spend most of his life as an expatriate in paris
lines.name: English

lines.value: a classical scholar korais was repelled by the byzantine influence in greek society and was a fierce critic of the lack of education amongst the clergy and their subservience to the ottoman empire although he conceded it was the orthodox church that preserved the national identity of greeks
lines.name: English

lines.value: while in paris he was witness to the french revolution
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was influenced by the revolutionary and liberal sentiments of his age
lines.name: English

lines.value: he admired thomas jefferson and exchanged political and philosophical thoughts with the american statesman
lines.name: English

lines.value: a typical man of the enlightenment korais encouraged wealthy greeks to open new libraries and schools throughout greece
lines.name: English

lines.value: korais believed that education would ensure not only the achievement of independence but also the establishment of a proper constitution for the new liberated greek state
lines.name: English

lines.value: he envisioned a democratic greece recapturing the glory of the golden age of pericles
lines.name: English

lines.value: korais died in paris aged 84 soon after publishing the first volume of his autobiography
lines.name: English

lines.value: in 1877 his remains were sent to greece to be buried there
lines.name: English

lines.value: korais's most lasting contributions were literary
lines.name: English

lines.value: those who were instrumental in publishing and presenting his work to the public were merchants from chios
lines.name: English

lines.value: he felt eternally grateful to these merchants since without them it would have been financially impossible for him to publish his works
lines.name: English

lines.value: these works included strabo in greek another on marcus aurelius his translation of herodotus the translation of the iliad and his main literary work the seventeen volumes of the library of greek literature
lines.name: English

lines.value: his political writing really begins with the publication at the opening of the nineteenth century of asma polemistirion war chant and salpisma polemistirion military bugal call celebrating the presence of greek troops fighting alongside the french in egypt
lines.name: English

lines.value: earlier he had attacked with his adelphiki didaskalia the greek patriarch of jerusalem for urging the sultan's christian subjects to support him in the war against the atheistic french
lines.name: English

lines.value: korais went on to publish in 1803 his report on the present state of civilization in greece based on a series of lectures he had given in paris extolling the link between the rise of a new greek mercantile class and the advance of the greek enlightenment or diafotismos
lines.name: English

lines.value: in what should we greeks do in the present circumstances a work of 1805 he tried to win his compatriots over to napoleon and away from the cause of their russian co religionists
lines.name: English

lines.value: in later years though his enthusiasm for the french emperor diminished and he ended by referring to him as the tyrant of tyrants away from contemporary politics korais did much to revive the idea of greece with the creation of the hellenic library devoted to new editions of some of the classic texts starting with homer in 1805
lines.name: English

lines.value: over the following twenty years many others appeared with lengthy prefaces by korais entitled impromptu reflections with his views on political educational and linguistic matters
lines.name: English

lines.value: although the broad mass of the greek people was beyond his reach he played an important part in the shaping of a new consciousness among the intelligentsia which was to play a part in the creation of a new national movement
lines.name: English

lines.value: korais was a greek orthodox but also a critic of many practices of the orthodox church
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a fierce critic of the ecumenical patriarch of constantinople considering it as a useful tool in the hands of the ottomans against the greek independence
lines.name: English

lines.value: so later he was one of the supporters of the new established church of greece
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was also critic of the monasticism the ignorance of the clergy and practices like that of the holy fire
lines.name: English

lines.value: he was a supporter of religious freedom empiricism rationalism and tolerance
lines.name: English

lines.value: he set himself in opposition to some metaphysical ideals of greek custom and sought to mould greek orthodoxy towards a more syncretic religious basis in order to bring it under the auspices of liberal thought and government
lines.name: English

lines.value: one of his most significant accomplishments was his contribution to the redefining of the greek language
lines.name: English

lines.value: the greeks were dispersed so widely across europe people who served several masters
lines.name: English

lines.value: he decided to purge the demotic the vernacular or spoken language of foreign elements
lines.name: English

lines.value: his intent was to bring the language as close as possible to the classic of ancient greece
lines.name: English

lines.value: this effort ultimately led to his publishing the atakta the first modern greek dictionary
lines.name: English

lines.value: unknown to most korais held passionate views on how the legal system should function in a democracy views which of course were greatly influenced by the french enlightenment closer to montesquieu than to rousseau and managed to have a great albeit indirect impact on the constitutions of the greek revolution but also primarily on the constitutions or syntagma created after the end of the greek revolution
lines.name: English

lines.value: this element holds significant importance if one takes into consideration the fact that these meta revolution constitutions still to the present day form the basis of the greek constitution and the philosophy on which the guiding principles of the greek legal and judicial system are rooted in.this influence korais exercised on greek law was due to a personal relationship the intellectual formed with another greek intellectual the legal scholar of international repute n i saripolos who after the greek revolution became the founding father of greek law and the author of the greek constitution
lines.name: English

lines.value: proof of this relationship and of the strong and progressive views korais held on how the legal system of the new greek state should be formed is based on correspondence exchanged between the two men during a long period of time beginning before the greek revolution
lines.name: English

lines.value: these letters which manifest the influence the older intellectual korais had on the then aspiring lawmaker saripolos are in the possession of the archives of the greek national library were discovered and brought to academic light in 1996 by a law school student researching a project sponsored by the faculty of law of the university of athens and the national academy for constitutional research and public law adjacent to the university of athens
